text.title: Wikinews interviews Stephen Murphy about the upcoming by-election in the Higgins electorate of the Australian parliament

head.s: Wikinews interviews Stephen Murphy about the upcoming by-election in the Higgins electorate of the Australian parliament

text.p:
With two
by-elections
coming up in
Australia
, many minor parties and independents will be looking to gain a seat in the House of Representatives .
Stephen Murphy
is one of the independents .

p.s:
Mr Murphy is a computer programmer from the
Melbourne
suburb of
Brunswick
.
" After growing up in South-East Melbourne I studied Science at Monash with first class Honours , worked in Europe for 10 years and have recently returned to Australia .
I work in finance as a computer programmer and speak five languages , " Mr Murphy said .

Wikinews reporter
Patrick Gillett
held an exclusive email interview with Mr Murphy , candidate for the
Division of Higgins
.

p.hi: Why do you want to get into parliament ?

p.s: I am standing up for what I believe is the correct course of action on the biggest issue in Australian politics in 100 years - Kevin Rudd 's flawed emissions trading scheme ( ETS ) .

p.hi: What would the three main policies you are taking into this by-election be ?

text.p:
SM :
I will oppose the emissions trading scheme , ensure that all government policy is based on accurate scientific evidence and return common sense to Canberra

p.hi: How would you address these policies ?

text.p:
SM :
By asking for a Royal Commission into climate change so that the facts ( such as that global warming stopped in 2001 and the emissions trading scheme will not change the climate one bit ) are openly presented to the Australian people .

p.hi: Sending asylum seekers to Indonesia : good or bad ?

text.p:
SM :
Any government policy that does not properly consider all implications ( be it emissions trading , or any other issue ) is a bad one .

caption.s: File photo : Loy Yang Power Station supplies electricity around the Australian state of Victoria .

p.hi: Is the Australian dollar 's near parity with the US dollar a sign that the Australian economy is healthy , the US economy in chaos or both ?

text.p:
SM :
It 's a sign of both .
Many countries around the world look with envy at how well ( relatively ) Australia is doing , to our credit !
It is of concern that the American economy is in such bad shape and that their levels of debt seem unsustainable .

p.hi: How do you rate the governments economic stimulus package ?

text.p:
SM :
The economic stimulus package was poorly targeted and poorly carried out .
When we could have been building roads , dams , railways and hospitals yet instead we were paying for tattoos , PlayStations and overseas holidays .

SM :
The question about levels of stimulus spending is a complicated one and requires expertise in economics , however one could say in general terms that all government spending should be well targeted and spent in the most efficient way .

p.hi: Is Kevin Rudd a better Prime Minister than John Howard ? '

p.s: Australian voters are the best judge of that and we will know in 2019 : )

p.hi: Is the Carbon Pollution Reduction Scheme an effective solution to climate change ? Why ?

text.p:
SM :
Absolutely not .
The CPRS will not change the climate by any amount that we can measure - it 's just a new tax that will hurt Australians and drive businesses and jobs overseas .
Since 2003 there has been mountains of new scientific data which contradicts the popular theory that human carbon dioxide emissions are causing significant global warming .
Recently , many of the scientists who wrote the IPCC report ( on which the ETS / CPRS is based ) have been reported as manipulating scientific data to create scary global warming scenarios .
The science is definitely not settled

SM :
We can very easily refocus the momentum and goodwill that has been generated on climate change and channel this energy into other worthwhile environmental projects in Australia that will make a difference .

p.hi: Why should the electorate vote for you ?

text.p:
SM :
I will oppose the ETS and support responsible environmental policies instead of radical environmental policies that could end up costing every Australian taxpayer $ 4550 per year in new taxes .
